pages.text: It seems dividing an iron ingot by a diamond will yield some sort of Unstable Ingot. $(br2)This ingot seems to be quite unstable, (hence the name), as it cannot be held for very long.

pages.title: Unstable Ingot
pages.text: $(c)Warning: Be sure you are ready to craft this item, otherwise you may be in for an explosive surprise. $()$(br2)Maybe there is a safer way to craft this?
It seems using netherite scrap in place of iron ingots yields a more stable version of the Unstable Ingot.
This special version of the Unstable Ingot can be crafted anywhere, and makes the ingot stable enough to be held in the player's hand without exploding.
